intro: Erianthera lobelioides, commonly known as the swamp beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems and produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating to help retain moisture. Erianthera lobelioides is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
